solution_line_template: Since a dozen has {items_per_dozen} items, the box has {water_bottle_dozens} dozen water bottles, a total of {water_bottle_dozens}*{items_per_dozen}=<<{water_bottle_dozens}*{items_per_dozen}={water_bottles}>>{water_bottles} water bottles.
The box also has half a dozen more apple bottles than water bottles, meaning there are {half_dozen_fraction}*{items_per_dozen}= {additional_apple_bottles} more apple bottles than water bottles.
The total number of apple bottles in the box is {water_bottles}+{additional_apple_bottles} = <<{water_bottles}+{additional_apple_bottles}={apple_bottles}>>{apple_bottles}
In the box, there are a total of {apple_bottles}+{water_bottles} =<<{apple_bottles}+{water_bottles}={total_bottles}>>{total_bottles} bottles
